snippet: As potential audience members scoured Mr. Noah’s past work and social media, they uncovered many posts on his Twitter account that they deemed to be offensive to women or Jews.
abstract: Trevor Noah, South African comedian signed to replace Jon Stewart on Comedy Central's The Daily Show, is facing intense public scrutiny after show's fans uncovered a number of his Twitter posts that they deemed were insulting to women or Jews; network defends Noah, arguing that it is unfair to judge him over a few jokes.
lead_paragraph: As potential audience members scoured Mr. Noah’s past work and social media, they uncovered many posts on his Twitter account that they deemed to be offensive to women or Jews.

headline.main: Comedy Central Stands Behind Trevor Noah, New ‘Daily Show’ Host, Amid Scrutiny
